alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 8:54AM EST until January 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton County. For the Chowan Basin...including Sebrell...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Sections of State Route 653, Carys Bridge Road are innundated, including areas 1/4 mile east of the bridge crossing the Nottoway River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Tuesday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday evening and continue falling to 12.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This level compares to a previous crest of 19.0 feet on 02/20/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
